class FCN[source]

FCN(c_in, c_out, layers=[128, 256, 128], kss=[7, 5, 3]) :: Module

Same as nn.Module, but no need for subclasses to call super().__init__

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
xb = torch.rand(16, 3, 128)
test_eq(FCN(3,2)(xb).shape, [xb.shape[0], 2])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
FCN(3,2)

FCN(
  (conv1): Sequential(
    (0): ConvSame1d(
      (conv1d_same): Conv1d(3, 128, kernel_size=(7,), stride=(1,))
    )
    (1): BatchNorm1d(128, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
    (2): ReLU()
  )
  (conv2): Sequential(
    (0): ConvSame1d(
      (conv1d_same): Conv1d(128, 256, kernel_size=(5,), stride=(1,))
    )
    (1): BatchNorm1d(256, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
    (2): ReLU()
  )
  (conv3): Sequential(
    (0): ConvSame1d(
      (conv1d_same): Conv1d(256, 128, kernel_size=(3,), stride=(1,))
    )
    (1): BatchNorm1d(128, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
    (2): ReLU()
  )
  (gap): AdaptiveAvgPool1d(output_size=1)
  (squeeze): Squeeze()
  (fc): Linear(in_features=128, out_features=2, bias=True)
)
{% endraw %}
